title: Wild Card Weekend: Packers Winners and Losers vs. the Bears
description: The Green Bay Packers‚Äô highs and lows from a crushing playoff loss to the Chicago Bears.
fullText:
And just like that, the Green Bay Packers‚Äô 2025 season is over. After a hot start to the year with big wins over the Detroit Lions and Washington Commanders, the team found themselves on a downward trajectory after major injuries to their most important playmakers. A 4-game losing streak turned into a 5-game losing streak after the Packers fell 31-27 against the Chicago Bears in the Wild Card round of the playoffs. Simply put: it‚Äôs a devastating way to end the season, but we can all rest now. Let‚Äôs dive into the winners and losers from the Packers‚Äô final game of the season.

My boy, my baby boy. We‚Äôve been waiting all season for Matthew Golden‚Äôs coveted first NFL touchdown, and Saturday night, he finally got his moment. After a year full of limited opportunities in the receiving game, Golden was one of Jordan Love‚Äôs go-to players against the Bears on an offense that just couldn‚Äôt get the run game going. He was running routes really well, and used his speed to extend plays. He also had his ‚Äúwow‚Äù moment, a 23-yard touchdown catch on a play which could‚Äôve ended 10 yards sooner. The effort on this play was stunning‚ÄîI didn‚Äôt think Golden had this in him. He finished the night catching 4 of 5 targets for 84 yards and a score. The rookie looked phenomenal in the game that mattered most, and I can‚Äôt wait to see what year 2 looks like.

WHAT A TIME FOR MATTHEW GOLDEN'S FIRST TOUCHDOWN OF THE SEASON

GBvsCHI on Prime Video
Also streaming on @NFLPlus pic.twitter.com/s0j2j3XGKC

Simply put: I‚Äôm not sure what else Jordan Love could‚Äôve done for the Packers last night. He‚Äôs finally entered ‚Äúif he‚Äôs your quarterback, your team has a chance‚Äù territory, but the problem is‚Ä¶the team. The offensive line did Love no favors, and it didn‚Äôt help that Sean Rhyan and Jacob Monk, their #2 and #3 options at center, both went down during the game. The run game did absolutely nothing, with Josh Jacobs averaging a paltry 2.9 yards per carry. There were egregious drops from the receivers, which has been the story of the last two years.

Despite all of this, Love was still able to throw for 323 yards and 4 TDs with 24 completions on 46 attempts. He spread the love (I‚Äôm sorry) last night, throwing to 9 different pass catchers, and all 4 of his TD passes were to different receivers. He‚Äôs finally a calm and composed veteran under center, but the rest of the team needs some serious work for this offense to stop the late-game slides.

Bird doing Bird things

üì∫: Prime Video pic.twitter.com/vGmHUS3YDJ

‚Äî Green Bay Packers (@packers) January 11, 2026

Brandon McManus left 7 points on the field after two missed FG attempts and a missed XP attempt. The Packers lost by 4. If I‚Äôm doing the math correctly, this guy needs to not be a Packer anymore.

The field goal is no good üëÄ

Bears take over still down 3

GBvsCHI on Prime Video
Also streaming on @NFLPlus pic.twitter.com/ouDcHxnkgp

I disagree with the sentiment that Matt LaFleur has been on the hot seat all season, but I do think his seat warmed up after an inexcusable collapse to the Bears in the playoffs. After being up 18 points, it was the Packers‚Äô game to lose, and they did just that. They lost. For whatever reason, LaFleur seems set on running the ball in early, long yardage situations. If it works, fine! But it doesn‚Äôt work. I counted 6 third-and-longs last night as a direct result of running the ball for a gain of 1 or 2 beforehand. The team was only able to run for a total of 99 yards last night, and it was clear early in the game that it wasn‚Äôt working.

The team scored once in the second half‚Äîa concerning trend throughout the year. We saw collapses against the Browns. The Cowboys. The Broncos. The Bears once, and now the Bears twice. Again‚ÄîI don‚Äôt think I agree with firing LaFleur, because I‚Äôm not sure who would be an adequate replacement. However, something has to change. Is it the offensive coordinator? Is it play calling duties? I‚Äôm not sure, but this game was one of the worst of LaFleur‚Äôs 7 year tenure.

FIRE JEFF HAFLEY. Just kidding, but also‚Ä¶what? The defense did a really great job in the first half of the game, limiting the Bears to just 3 points in their first drive, and ending their next three drives in turnovers. They were even okay in the third quarter‚Äîjust three more points from the Bears, and another Caleb Williams interception. If you want to stop reading here, I don‚Äôt blame you.

In the fourth quarter of the game, the Packers allowed 25 points. The Bears scored during every drive of the game‚Äôs final quarter, and they did it rather quickly‚Äîtheir longest drive of the quarter was just 2:30. Offenses collapse sometimes. I get it. Defenses collapse sometimes. I get it. When both collapse at the same time, you cannot win football games.

With the season officially over for the Packers, we are all finally out of our misery, for the time being. When the 2026 season begins in September, we should have both Tucker Kraft and Micah Parsons back from their torn ACLs‚Äîtwo players whose presence could‚Äôve saved last night‚Äôs game. The roster and coaching staff will no doubt look a little different, with the possible departure of guys like Romeo Doubs, Elgton Jenkins, Rashan Gary, and Jeff Hafley, among others. Will the team be able to do what it takes to keep their Super Bowl window open? We‚Äôll find out a year from now. Stay tuned.

title: üö® BREAKING: Barcelona and Real Madrid name XIs for Supercopa final

fullText:
It's time for the big one; another chapter in the annals of El Cl√°sico as Barcelona and Real Madrid prepare to lock horns in the Supercopa de Espa√±a final.

The pair of Spanish giants are once again commanding headlines on the Iberian peninsula in 2025/26 and slugging it out at the top of La Liga, with Blaugrana currently holding a strong hand on the back of their league position.

But Xabi Alonso's Los Blancos will no doubt fancy their chances in a one-off high-intensity fixture, and will draw confidence from their 2-1 win against Hansi Flick's outfit back in October.

Here is how the two legendary clubs will be deployed this evening at Jeddah's Alinma Stadium.

Will it be another moment where Flick's influence pays dividends for the Catalans, or will this be the first major piece of silverware for Alonso since his return to the Spanish capital?

title: Former Texas A&M QB, Heisman winner explains "College Gameday" absence
description: Former Texas A&M quarterback Johnny Manziel unveiled the reasoning behind his missed appearance on "College Gameday" before the CFP.
fullText:
After missing his "College Gameday" appearance before the Aggies competed against the Hurricanes in the first round of the CFP, former Heisman-winning quarterback and Texas A&M legend Johnny Manziel explained his side of the story on his Glory Daze podcast.

According to Manziel, he missed the scheduled appearance as a guest picker due to a virus that made him sick the night before. He originally planned to attend with music artist Drake and watch Texas A&M take on Miami, but the illness prevented that.

Manziel played for the Aggies in 2012 and 2013, becoming the first-ever freshman Heisman winner and just the second player to win the award in program history. Here is the full clip of Manziel discussing the incident that led to his missed appearance.

Former Texas A&M QB Johnny Manziel explained on his podcast what went into him missing his scheduled ‚ÄúCollege GameDay‚Äù appearance for A&M vs. Miami. He said he planned to go to the game with Drake but got sick the night before with an ‚Äúunbelievable‚Äù virus. https://t.co/jYbSoxsig8 pic.twitter.com/Z7guLzSghd

‚Äî Carter Karels (@CarterKarels) January 8, 2026

While rumors ran rampant across social media when former Aggie basketball player Alex Caruso was named the guest picker in place of Manziel, he seemed to shut those down on the most recent episode of his podcast. Manziel was in attendance for multiple contests at Kyle Field in 2025, while also spending time with current Texas A&M quarterback Marcel Reed, who displayed much improvement this season at the helm and will return to play for the Maroon and White for his junior season.

The year didn't conclude as the Aggies had wished, but head coach Mike Elko has led the program to historic heights in just his second season coaching in Bryan-College Station, Texas. Elko's squad secured the school's first 11-0 start since 1992 and its first playoff appearance in 2025.

Contact/Follow us¬†@AggiesWire¬†on X¬†(formerly Twitter) and like our page on¬†Facebook¬†to follow ongoing coverage of Texas A&M news, notes and opinions.¬†Follow Dylan on X:¬†@dylanmflippo.

title: Report: West Ham United eyeing shock move to sign Tottenham Hotspur star
description: West Ham Turn to Spurs as Goalkeeping Woes DeepenWest Ham United‚Äôs January search for survival has taken a familiar turn towards north London. According to the Daily Mail, the Hammers have now ‚Äúma...
fullText:
West Ham United‚Äôs January search for survival has taken a familiar turn towards north London. According to the Daily Mail, the Hammers have now ‚Äúmade contact with Tottenham Hotspur about a January move to sign goalkeeper Antonin Kinsky‚Äù, a development that reflects both urgency and uncertainty at the London Stadium.

This has been a bruising campaign. West Ham sit seven points adrift of safety, already having parted company with Graham Potter, while Nuno Espirito Santo now finds himself under mounting pressure. The Daily Mail report makes clear that the Portuguese coach views the winter window as a final lifeline, with a goalkeeper identified as a priority.

Espirito Santo, himself a former FC Porto stopper, understands the psychological weight of that position. When confidence drains from the back, results often follow.

West Ham have already acted to address their lack of goals, completing deals for Pablo and Taty Castellanos. Attention has now shifted to damage limitation. Too many goals conceded, too many leads squandered, and too many afternoons defined by defensive uncertainty.

The Daily Mail state that ‚ÄúWest Ham have now made contact with London rivals Tottenham over a potential move to sign Czech Republic international Kinsky this month.‚Äù The 22 year old arrived at Spurs in January 2025 under Ange Postecoglou, initially deputising during Guglielmo Vicario‚Äôs injury absence.

That early exposure brought promise, but opportunity soon vanished.

Once Vicario returned to fitness, the hierarchy reasserted itself. Under Thomas Frank, Kinsky has made just two appearances this season, both in the Carabao Cup, and ‚Äúkeeping two clean sheets in the process.‚Äù For a young goalkeeper, that is both a reminder of his quality and a frustration at his limited pathway.

Tottenham‚Äôs position is pragmatic. Vicario remains first choice, and squad balance matters. A loan or permanent move could suit all parties, particularly if minutes are guaranteed elsewhere.

West Ham‚Äôs recent missteps have been highlighted. The club spent around ¬£20m on Mads Hermansen last summer, only for the Dane to concede ‚Äú14 goals in his first four appearances‚Äù before losing his place to Alphonse Areola. Now, ‚ÄúNuno has made it clear to him that he has no future at the club‚Äù, leaving West Ham scrambling once more.

Areola has not disgraced himself, yet results continue to slide. As the report notes, ‚ÄúWhile Areola hasn‚Äôt particularly done anything wrong this season, he can‚Äôt stop conceding goals.‚Äù In a relegation battle, perception becomes reality.

Kinsky is described as ‚Äúphenomenal‚Äù, and while that label carries optimism rather than proof, desperation sharpens decision making. The defence has been fragile, but goalkeepers often become the final line of belief.

Tottenham may be open to a deal given Kinsky‚Äôs lack of involvement, and the player himself would likely welcome a chance to play regularly. With weeks remaining in the window, this feels like a situation driven by necessity rather than luxury.

For West Ham supporters, this report rings with uncomfortable familiarity. Another January, another scramble, another attempt to fix deep structural problems with short term solutions. Yet the interest in Kinsky makes sense. Fans understand that survival sometimes requires calculated risk.

Kinsky‚Äôs appeal lies in freshness. He arrives without baggage from this season‚Äôs struggles and with something to prove. Supporters may see him as a psychological reset as much as a tactical one. When confidence drains from the stands, a new face can change the mood.

Tottenham fans, meanwhile, are likely indifferent but pragmatic. Kinsky is well regarded, but Vicario is established. Allowing a talented backup to gain minutes elsewhere could be sensible squad management, provided Spurs retain long term control.

Both fanbases will recognise the gamble. For West Ham, it is about hope and momentum. For Tottenham, it is about asset value and development. In a relegation fight, those motivations can align briefly, even between rivals.

title: Wild Card Round: Bills at Jaguars - Live Discussion
description: The Jaguars are slight 1.5-point favorites over the Bills at home for this Wild Card matchup. Join us in the comments!
fullText:
The AFC gets its first playoff game of the year with Josh Allen and the Buffalo Bills on the road in Florida to take on the three-seed of Trevor Lawrence and the Jacksonville Jaguars. This game has all of the hallmarks of a shootout style game late. I have a feeling the team with the ball last might be the one that wins, which means we‚Äôre going to see a 13-10 barnburner instead‚Ä¶ I kid, I kid.

Kickoff is set fora.m. Mile High time at EverBank Stadium in Jacksonville, Florida and will air on CBS.

According to FanDuel, the Jaguars are slight 1.5-point home favorites over the Bills. I flipflopped between both teams on this prediction. Ultimately, I came down with experience. Allen and the Bills have been here before and are truly battle tested in elimination games. The Jaguars are like the Denver Broncos last year. Lacking in playoff experience and it could show here. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôll be a blowout, because the Bills defense has been a bit suspect this season. But when the game is on the line, I think I trust Josh Allen just a little bit more right now.

Prediction: Bills 33, Jaguars 31.

title: Matthew Stafford injury update: Latest news on Rams QB getting tests on finger after wild-card win over Panthers
description: Following the Rams' win over the Panthers in the wild-card, the top storyline coming out of the game was Matthew Stafford's finger.
fullText:
Matthew Stafford injury update: Latest news on Rams QB getting tests on finger after wild-card win over Panthers originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

While there was¬†collective relief among Rams fans that Los Angeles avoided a first-round loss to the Carolina Panthers, there is something else for them to worry about.

Matthew Stafford was¬†sacked only once, but he was pressured nine times and took a few punishing blows. He left the game with an injury, and the Rams faithful should monitor it ahead of their divisional matchup.

The Sporting News has everything you need to know about Stafford's injury update following their wild-card win.

MORE:¬†Three problems Rams must fix in NFC playoffs

Following his injury, Stafford received X-rays on his throwing hand.

The good news for the Rams and their fan base is that Stafford's X-rays¬†on his hand came back negative. This was confirmed by Ian Rapoport on Sunday morning. There was no dislocation, and it was simply a bad case of getting his hand bent back.

Even if there was a dislocation or fracture, with how tough Stafford is, he probably would have played through it.

After being pressured nine times in their win over the Panthers, Stafford certainly woke up sore the next day. On one of those hits in particular, his throwing hand collided with a defender, which immediately looked to bother the veteran quarterback.

Injured again: #Rams QB Matthew Stafford take another big hit on that hand.

This is getting worse. He was down for a minute pic.twitter.com/3lWdCHndNG

‚Äî FirstDownMedia (@FirstDownMediaa) January 10, 2026

%3Cscript%20async%20src%3D%22https%3A%2F%2Fplatform.twitter.com%2Fwidgets.js%22%20charset%3D%22utf-8%22%3E%3C%2Fscript%3E

Stafford is one of the toughest players ever to play the quarterback position, but this hand injury caused real in-game problems. Following this hit, Stafford completed only two of his next 10 passing attempts.

This did seem to spark a Panthers comeback, but luckily for the Rams, they have an MVP candidate and future Hall of Famer under center.

MORE:¬†Why Matthew Stafford's performance dipped after hurting hand

While there is no concrete reporting on whether Stafford will play or not next week, there's a pretty large sample size to look at.

Stafford is one of the toughest quarterbacks in NFL history. There is evidence dating back to his days with the Detroit Lions, when he threw a game-winning touchdown pass despite a dislocated shoulder.

Golden Tate, who is a former teammate of Stafford, shared a story following his hand injury on Saturday.

One time Stafford messed up a finger on his throwing hand. I checked on him like ‚Äúyou good?‚Äù
He said, ‚Äúbro I‚Äôm straight‚Ä¶ I got nine other fingers.‚Äù
He‚Äôs different!

‚Äî Golden Tate (@ShowtimeTate) January 11, 2026

While there is not going to be anything set in stone this soon after the injury, it's fair to assume that Stafford is not going to miss a playoff game due to a non-serious hand injury.

title: Report: Liverpool in contact over move for ¬£60m star
description: Liverpool Maintain Regular Contact as Transfer Plans Take ShapeLiverpool‚Äôs recruitment work remains firmly ongoing, despite last summer delivering a Premier League title and a significant refresh of...
fullText:
Liverpool‚Äôs recruitment work remains firmly ongoing, despite last summer delivering a Premier League title and a significant refresh of the squad. Credit must go to TEAMtalk for the original report, which sheds light on a familiar name continuing to feature prominently in the club‚Äôs forward planning.

Under Arne Slot, Liverpool have taken a measured and data led approach to squad building, but there is a clear sense that further evolution is required. While the collapse of a late move for Marc Guehi left some frustration, attention has now turned towards attacking depth, particularly on the left side of the frontline.

Injuries have played their part in shaping January discussions, with Alexander Isak‚Äôs leg break limiting options across the front line. However, the lack of a natural replacement following Luis Diaz‚Äôs departure last summer has been evident for some time.

Cody Gakpo has shouldered much of the responsibility, with Rio Ngumoha also used in flashes, but Liverpool‚Äôs recruitment team are clearly exploring alternatives with greater consistency and upside. The left wing is viewed as an area where elite competition could raise the overall attacking level.

According to TEAMtalk, Liverpool remain in regular contact with Paris Saint-Germain forward Bradley Barcola, a player who has been tracked for a considerable period. His situation in Paris remains uncertain, with negotiations over a new contract ongoing but no guarantees over his long term role.

The report states that PSG have ruled out a January exit, though the summer window could tell a different story. Valued at ‚Ç¨69.6m (¬£60m) and under contract until 2028, Barcola is attracting interest from Chelsea, Arsenal and Manchester City, underlining his standing across Europe.

Barcola‚Äôs recent involvement at PSG has been limited, having ‚Äústarted on the bench for five of PSG‚Äôs last six league games, being an unused substitute twice.‚Äù That context matters. Liverpool will be monitoring whether this pattern continues under Luis Enrique.

Slot can offer something compelling, a defined role, tactical clarity and the promise of regular minutes in a title challenging side. Richard Hughes and his recruitment staff are unlikely to force matters in January, but groundwork is clearly being laid should circumstances shift.

From a Liverpool supporter‚Äôs perspective, this report feels quietly encouraging rather than headline grabbing. The key detail is not an imminent bid, but the fact that regular contact is being maintained. That suggests intent and patience, two traits that have defined Liverpool‚Äôs smartest recruitment cycles in recent years.

Bradley Barcola fits the profile many fans hoped for after Luis Diaz left. Young, technically strong, comfortable on the left and capable of stretching defences. Watching Gakpo adapt admirably has been positive, but there is room for another elite option who naturally thrives in wide areas.

Arne Slot‚Äôs system relies heavily on wide attackers who can receive between the lines and carry threat in isolation. Barcola looks well suited to that role, especially if offered trust and continuity. The idea that Liverpool could present him with a guaranteed place in the XI feels realistic rather than speculative.

Supporters also appreciate the calm approach. There is no sense of panic buying, even with injuries disrupting plans. Instead, Liverpool appear content to wait for the right moment, trusting that situations like Barcola‚Äôs can evolve quickly.

If this one reaches the summer, optimism will grow. Liverpool staying close, informed and ready to move is often how the most successful deals begin.

title: Ben Johnson reconfirms that coaches, players look for any motivation
description: After Bears coach Ben Johnson delivered a four-letter message to the Packers in the locker room after Saturday night's win over Green Bay, Johnson took to the podium to explain that his team perceived disrespect in advance of the third ever playoff meeting between the hundred-year rivals.
fullText:
After Bears coach Ben Johnson delivered a four-letter message to the Packers in the locker room after Saturday night's win over Green Bay, Johnson took to the podium to explain that his team perceived disrespect in advance of the third ever playoff meeting between the hundred-year rivals.

‚ÄúThere was probably a little bit more noise coming out of their building up north to start the week, which we heard loud and clear, players and coaches alike," Johnson said.

Johnson didn't specify the noise. And if there was any, it wasn't loud enough to rise above the noise of a noisy week of NFL news.

As noted by ESPN.com, Packers receiver Christian Watson and cornerback Keisean Nixon said they wanted to face Chicago in the playoffs. Also, Packers defensive coordinator Jeff Hafley told reporters during his midweek press conference, "We are not going to be done, so I will see you guys next week."

Whatever it was, Johnson and the Bears saw it, and they milked it.

"It definitely got us riled up," Bears safety Kevin Byard III said. "It got us amped up for the game."

The point is this. They can act like they don't listen. But they do. They all do. And for any players or coaches who may create some noise, it's the NFL's version of the Miranda warnings.

Anything you say can and will be used against you.

title: Packers' collapse in Chicago provides fitting end to 2025 season
description: When push came to shove, the Packers couldn't finish -- providing a fitting end to the 2025 season.
fullText:
At almost every turn of the 2025 season, the Green Bay Packers failed to finish -- making Saturday night's collapse at Soldier Field in the NFC Wild Card Round a fitting conclusion to a season marked by missed opportunities and gut-wrenching losses torn from the jaws of victory.

Every NFL season has ebbs and flows. The Packers' dips were punctuated over and over again by collapse, and once injuries turned the once-promising season into a tailspin, the only logical conclusion was one final calamity, and Saturday night at Soldier Field did not disappoint.

It was a conglomeration of all the season's collapses, packaged nicely into one unforgettable defeat at the hands of the franchise's oldest rival.

It didn't take long for the 2025 Packers to show their untrustworthy side.

After looking like one of the NFL's top teams during the first two weeks, the Packers squandered a 10-0 lead in Cleveland, had a go-ahead field goal blocked and lost to the lowly Browns on a field goal as time expired.

A week later, the Packers led 13-0 early in Dallas and held two different leads in the fourth quarter but ended up incredibly fortunate to escape AT&T Stadium with what ended up being an incredibly important 40-40 tie.

After vanquishing Aaron Rodgers and the Steelers in primetime to get to get to 5-1-1, the Packers returned home and slopped through a 16-13 loss to the Panthers that saw Carolina win with a field goal as time expired after the Packers tied the game in the fourth quarter.

Then, after getting to 9-3-1 with a season-correcting four-game win streak, came one of the most torturous five-week stretches of recent Packers football. The tormenting began with an injury-ravaged collapse in Denver that saw the Packers lose Zach Tom (who didn't play again in 2025) and Micah Parsons (who tore his ACL) and lose the game after holding a 23-14 lead in the third quarter over the AFC's No. 1 seed. The Broncos went on a 20-3 run to win it. In many ways, the 2025 season died for the Packers on Sunday, Dec. 14 at Mile High. The corpse of Matt LaFleur's team never won again.

A week after the Denver debacle, the Packers botched an onside kick and gave up a fourth down touchdown pass, blowing a 10-point fourth quarter lead before losing on a game-ending touchdown pass in overtime in the first of two epic Soldier Field collapses.

The Packers became just the fourth playoff team in NFL history to lose four straight games to end the regular season. This was a ghost ship floating aimlessly into the postseason, but a chance at redemption arrived in the form of a rubber match with the Bears -- providing arguably the best possible matchup for a team that no longer belonged in the heavyweight class.

Yet the final kill shot arrived without mercy on Saturday night, when the Packers led 21-3 at halftime and 27-16 in the fourth quarter before losing 31-27 during one of the franchise's worst playoff collapses. A dominant first 30 minutes were no match for the pure chaos and buffoonery of the final 30.

The Packers played 18 games during the 2025 season and won nine, or exactly half of the games. In five of the failures, the Packers led by nine or more points.

In an astonishing season that still makes no sense, the Packers lost three games in which they never punted and didn't win in five games they lead by two scores.

Saturday's collapse will be studied for weeks, months. It was a truly incredible blend of stale offense, defeats at the line of scrimmage, kicking catastrophes, defensive rupturing and inexcusable coaching mistakes over a 30-minute span.

The stunning loss would have been inconceivable had it not been so well rehearsed. The 2025 Packers had been building to this moment all season. And now it is over, another season -- the 15th since winning a Super Bowl -- gone like a fart in the wind.

This article originally appeared on Packers Wire: Packers' collapse in Chicago provides fitting end to 2025 season

title: Update On Killer Kelly's TNA Status
description: Ahead of its AMC debut, TNA Wrestling re-signed a number of in-ring talents, but according to a new report, Killer Kelly was not one of them.
fullText:
Ahead of its AMC debut, TNA Wrestling re-signed a number of in-ring talents, including Mustafa Ali and TNA World Tag Team Champions The Hardy Boys. As seen in recent weeks, however, the company wasn't successful in all cases.

According to Fightful Select, Killer Kelly is another name that has departed from TNA Wrestling following the expiration of her latest contract. Last month, reports indicated that Kelly and TNA officials were in the midst of discussions regarding a possible extension. Evidently, that result didn't pan out as the outlet notes that Kelly has now "effectively left the company" with no creative plans currently in place for her.

Originally, Kelly's TNA deal was said to end in August 2025. Due to an absence stemming from maternity leave, though, an additional four months were tacked onto it.

Kelly, a former Knockouts Tag Team Champion, returned to TNA programming in June 2025, setting her sights on then-Knockouts Champion Masha Slamovich. Kelly went on to unsuccessfully challenge Slamovich in a chain match for the title on "TNA iMPACT." Her last TNA in-ring appearance, taped on December 7, saw her take a loss to Myla Grace on "TNA Xplosion."

As of this writing, Kelly's potential next moves in wrestling are unknown. Meanwhile, Jake Something wasted little time to secure a new home for himself following the expiration of his respective TNA contract on January 1. Something, now known as Jake Doyle, was announced as the newest member of All Elite Wrestling roster¬†after his introduction from Don Callis on last Wednesday's edition of "AEW Dynamite."

Don't miss any of the major wrestling headlines. You can also add us as a preferred search source on Google.

title: Browns led NFL in one crazy stat that bodes well for their future
description: While the Browns only won five games in 2025, this one key stat may just prove for a brighter future in Cleveland.
fullText:
The Cleveland Browns may have only won five games in 2025, but they may not be far off, and their future is bright.

As the NFL wildcard weekend continues, ESPN showed a graphic on the youngest wide receivers in the NFL, and the Browns led the league in one key statistic. What was that statistic?

They led the NFL in snaps played by a rookie, and they led it by a landslide. According to ESPN, the Browns had 5,971 snaps played by a rookie in 2025. This was the most by over 600 snaps played. The New York Jets were second on the list with 5,327 snaps played by a rookie this past season.

This makes sense when considering that rookie quarterbacks started most of the season for the Browns, a rookie led them in rushing and receiving, their starting middle linebacker was a rookie, as was one of their starting defensive tackles. The rookies played well this season, and that bodes well for the future of the franchise.

‚Äî Mike Kadlick (@mikekadlick) January 11, 2026

Just look at the Patriots. They are in their second season after landing a quarterback in the 2024 NFL Draft. They did not even start him right away and gave him an on-ramp to the field as a rookie. Now, they are AFC East champs and are in contention for a Super Bowl after winning 14 games.

Of course, the key difference between the Browns and the Patriots right now is that the Browns are still hunting for their quarterback of the future. Well, and a head coach.

This article originally appeared on Browns Wire: Browns led NFL in one crazy stat that bodes well for their future

title: Patriots vs. Chargers: LB Khalil Mack Reveals LA‚Äôs Strategy to Stop Drake Maye Ahead of the Wildcard Clash
description: The LA Chargers and New England Patriots matchup is among the more even contests of Wild Card weekend. Both teams have been impressive at times and are led by their quarterbacks, Drake Maye and Justin Herbert.
fullText:
The LA Chargers and New England Patriots matchup is among the more even contests of Wild Card weekend. Both teams have been impressive at times and are led by their quarterbacks, Drake Maye and Justin Herbert. The position could be the biggest differentiating factor when it‚Äôs all said and done.

After all, Maye is up for the MVP award. Herbert, on the other hand, isn‚Äôt up for any awards‚Ä¶ except for his second-career Pro Bowl. But he logged another solid season with the Bolts, ranking in the top 10 in passing yards, passing TDs, and completions.

No offense to Herbert, but Maye will be the focal point on Sunday. He‚Äôs been stellar all season and is evolving into the next face of the NFL. That‚Äôs why, when Chargers defender Khalil Mack was asked about the Patriots QB, he gave the man his flowers.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs special, man. He has the arm talent, looks pretty fast as well. So, it‚Äôs going to be a challenge for us to keep him in the pocket,‚Äù Mack told the media via the LA Chargers YouTube.

But he didn‚Äôt stop there. The former Defensive Player of the Year went on to describe the multiple ways Maye can hurt them, and what they need to do to stop it.

‚ÄúRushing coverage is going to have to work well. Just understanding we gotta rush four as one up front. Keep him contained in the pocket. Not letting him get out whenever he doesn‚Äôt see anybody open,‚Äù Mack listed before continuing,

‚ÄúOn the back end, we‚Äôre going to have to cover as well, because he‚Äôs accurate and able to get the ball in all different types of spots.‚Äù

Maye led the NFL this season by completing 72% of his passes. It‚Äôs an otherworldly number, with the next closest contender more than two percentage points behind. He‚Äôs also thrown only eight INTs and fumbled the ball twice, making him a savant when it comes to taking care of the football.

Despite Maye‚Äôs effectiveness, Mack later shared that his defensive coordinator‚Äôs message to the defense ahead of the game hadn‚Äôt changed.

‚ÄúSame as it‚Äôs always been. Understanding who we want to be, the defense we want to be, and putting it on film. Honestly, not talking about it too much. But just knowing what we want to be, and we understand what we want to be,‚Äù Mack shared.

The Chargers‚Äô defense has been playing better as of late. In fact, they haven‚Äôt allowed an opposing team to score more than 21 points since Week 11. They simply need to stick to what‚Äôs been working over the past few months, and they could find themselves in a battle in the fourth quarter.

All in all, we know that Maye and Herbert are the main talking points in this matchup. However, this could be a sneaky, defensive battle. It‚Äôs Maye‚Äôs first career playoff game, and the Chargers‚Äô defense is hot. Meanwhile, Herbert also tends to struggle in playoff games, and the Patriots‚Äô defense could play a major role as well.

The sportsbooks are favoring Maye and the Pats right now by 3.5 points, and we aren‚Äôt going to disagree. Riding a three-game winning streak and carrying momentum all season long, New England should win this contest. We‚Äôll predict they take it 17-12 in a grinder of a game where the Chargers struggle to score touchdowns. It would be the Patriots‚Äô first playoff win since the 2018 season.

The post Patriots vs. Chargers: LB Khalil Mack Reveals LA‚Äôs Strategy to Stop Drake Maye Ahead of the Wildcard Clash appeared first on The SportsRush.

title: Why Red Sox missing out on Alex Bregman might be blessing in disguise
description: Boston is pivoting to infield options who might be better than Bregman.
fullText:
Why Red Sox missing out on Alex Bregman might be blessing in disguise originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Boston Red Sox were dealt some brutal news on Saturday night, as the Chicago Cubs swooped in and stole free-agent third baseman Alex Bregman.

He signed a five-year, $175 million deal with the Cubs, ditching the Red Sox for the Cubs. Boston will need to pivot to some other options this winter, and while there are a couple of decent choices, seeing Bregman leave is still a difficult situation to come to terms with.

Losing Bregman to the Cubs is a brutal situation for the Red Sox, but for Keith Law of The Athletic, it might actually not be the worst outcome. Law's opinion points to Bregman signing with the Cubs actually being a blessing in disguise for the Red Sox.

"The obvious answer for Boston would be to sign Bo Bichette... I'd rather have Bichette than Bregman anyway," Law writes, "and he's at least capable of backing up Trevor Story at short."

After losing Bregman to the Cubs, the Red Sox need to find an alternative to their infield hole. Fortunately, due to Marcelo Mayer being able to move to either second or third base, the Red Sox have some flexibility.

And for Law, signing Bichette, who's younger, and coming off a strong 2025 season with the Toronto Blue Jays, would be the better option anyway.

The Red Sox have some options to replace Bregman, and Bichette would be a clear answer for Boston this winter.

More:¬†Red Sox get brutal decision from Alex Bregman amid $175 million Cubs deal

Bregman's $175 million deal is far from cheap, even when factoring in the $70 million in deferrals the Cubs put into the contract.

Boston will likely pivot to new options for their infield addition this winter, and while losing Bregman stings, it might not be all that bad.

Law would prefer Bichette to Bregman anyway, and with the age difference (Bregman is 32 and Bichette is 28), it's not a far-fetched belief from Law.

The Red Sox might've received a blessing in disguise, seeing Bregman sign with the Cubs. Now, they can go after Bichette, who's a younger and arguably better fit for the Red Sox than Bregman would've been.

They still need to sign Bichette or another top infield option this winter. But if they can bring Bichette to Boston, then losing Bregman wouldn't be the horrible free-agent outcome it seems like.

title: AC Milan snatch late draw at Fiorentina as title rivals Inter face Napoli
description: AC Milan missed the chance to join Inter Milan at the top of Serie A on Sunday after snatching a late 1-1 draw at Fiorentina, ahead of their local rivals' clash with Scudetto rivals Napoli.Milan are at risk of falling five points off the title pace later on Sunday as Inter face reigning champions Napoli hunting a seventh straight league success.
fullText:
AC Milan missed the chance to join Inter Milan at the top of Serie A on Sunday after snatching a late 1-1 draw at Fiorentina, ahead of their local rivals' clash with Scudetto rivals Napoli.

Christopher Nkunku lashed home Milan's leveller in the 90th minute at the Stadio Artemio Franchi to deny Fiorentina just a third win of a troubled season.

Fiorentina had looked set for the points after Pietro Comuzzo headed home the opener in the 66th minute, but Nkunku's late strike left the Tuscans on 14 points in 18th place.

The hosts came close to nabbing all three points twice in stoppage time, with new signing Marco Brescianini hitting the bar from close range and Milan goalkeeper Mike Maignan having to dive at the feet of Moise Kean to stop the Italy striker from netting the winner.

"We played well in the first half and created a lot of chances that we failed to convert," said Milan coach Massimiliano Allegri to DAZN.

"We're second in the league and we need to keep it up, but we also need to be more clinical when we're dominating play."

Milan are at risk of falling five points off the title pace later on Sunday as Inter face reigning champions Napoli hunting a seventh straight league success.

Antonio Conte's Napoli trail Milan by two points and will take second spot with a win at the San Siro.

Fiorentina are two points behind Genoa who sit just outside the relegation zone and host Cagliari on Monday evening.

Paolo Vanoli's team seem to have turned a corner with one defeat in their last five matches, and fans are back onside after long periods of protest at bad results and a lack of direction behind the scenes.

Supporters applauded Fiorentina off the field after a second match in succession in which they were pegged back late on, a last-gasp Pedro penalty costing them a win at Lazio on Wednesday.

title: Sean McAdam: By losing Alex Bregman, Red Sox squander the trust they had earned back with fan base
description: The Red Sox lost more than a free agent Saturday night. They also lost credibility.
fullText:
In failing to outbid the Chicago Cubs and retain Alex Bregman, the Red Sox have succeeded in painting themselves into a corner.

There‚Äôs but one option remaining on the free agent market ‚Äî Bo Bichette ‚Äî and he‚Äôs going to require more money and a longer deal than Bregman just landed.

If you‚Äôre at all optimistic about the Red Sox winning that bidding war, congratulations ‚Äî you possess belief in the franchise that few can still muster.

In the end, the contract the Cubs gave Bregman wasn‚Äôt outlandish. It included deferrals that will lower the present-day value, as well as the AAV (average annual value), a key component when it comes to monitoring the CBT.

A year ago, the Red Sox got into a staredown with Bregman and his representatives and won. When Bregman finally agreed to a three-year, $120 million pact last February, camps had opened and time was running short.

The fit appeared perfect, too. Here was a winning player with known leadership abilities, a stout defender who offered righthanded balance to an increasingly lefty lineup.

The deal had something for both sides: Bregman landed a $40 million AAV, albeit one that was reduced some by deferrals, while giving him the added attraction of some opt-outs.

The Red Sox, meanwhile, got something far more for their money. When Bregman signed, the Red Sox regained some long-lost credibility with their fan base. The contract signaled that they were again serious about winning, and when that was followed two months later by a six-year contract extension for Garrett Crochet, fans were convinced that the era of austerity at Fenway was mercifully over.

The arrival of Bregman and Crochet, coupled with the influx of young talent, signaled that it was OK to trust the organization again. A return to the postseason, however brief, validated the whole approach.

And now? Now, the Red Sox are right back to where they were a year ago, their trust strained if not entirely spent, with few pathways back.

It‚Äôs impossible to feel sorry for them. The Sox were casual at best in their pursuit of alternatives earlier this offseason. They barely stirred when it came to Kyle Schwarber, and while many presumed he was always going to return to Philadelphia, the Red Sox, with their resources, could have given him something to think about. They did not.

They made an offer on Pete Alonso, but reportedly never went beyond a three-year proposal, a laughably underwhelming approach for a 30-year-old free agent in his prime with multiple teams interested.

If their laissez faire approach to other free agent sluggers signaled a confidence that Bregman would ultimately return to them, they learned otherwise, the hard way, late Saturday night.

And it‚Äôs not like there are several alternatives for them a month out from the start of spring training. Ketel Marte is officially off the trade market and Bichette has a number of different suitors, including the Philadelphia Phillies.

One could argue that the Phillies have chronically underachieved on the field in recent seasons, failing to get out of the Division Series in each of the last two seasons despite consecutive first-place finishes. Over the last four years, they‚Äôve gone from losing in the World Series to losing in the NLCS to twice losing in the Division Series.

But when they want or need a player, they usually get him. They made Schwarber a priority and re-signed him. And with new bench coach Don Mattingly, a known mentor to Bichette, they‚Äôre now considered the favorites to emerge as winners of these negotiations, too.

If they miss out on Bichette, the Sox will be forced to make do from within. They could install Marcelo Mayer at third and form a platoon of Romy Gonzalez and David Hamilton for second base, but both solutions are, to put it mildly, imperfect. Mayer, talented as he may be, hasn‚Äôt established himself and must prove he can stay on the field for an entire season. Gonzalez and Hamilton profile as role players now being asked to punch way above their weight.

That doesn‚Äôt begin to address the lack of pop, or the yawning leadership void that Bregman‚Äôs departure has created.

At the outset of the offseason, the Red Sox publicly acknowledged they needed additional power to not only compete in the division but to advance deeper in October. They acquired Willson Contreras, but his production merely matches what they got out of Bregman a year ago. Offensively speaking, the Sox are back to ground zero.

The Red Sox‚Äô unwillingness to get uncomfortable in pursuit of another championship has relegated them to a sort of baseball middle ground ‚Äî interesting and maybe even competitive, yes, but unable to take the extra step that would vault them to the next level.

Worse, they‚Äôve squandered the good will that they assiduously rebuilt a year ago, when for a brief moment in time, they convinced the fan base that they cared again.

And, as usual, they have no one to blame but themselves.

title: Packers' connection to John Harbaugh adds to Matt LaFleur firing rumors
description: Green Bay could choose to move on.
fullText:
Packers' connection to John Harbaugh adds to Matt LaFleur firing rumors originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Green Bay Packers have a Matt LaFleur decision to make.

Does the head coach get fired after a playoff loss to the Chicago Bears on Saturday? That blown lead by Green Bay was certainly painful. And, most intriguingly, they've got a connection to John Harbaugh.

Not many would've expected that Harbaugh would be available on the head coach market this offseason.

But then the Ravens went from Super Bowl favorites to missing the playoffs entirely, and Harbaugh was out of his job after 18 years at the helm in Baltimore.

Now, he's the top candidate available. And if the Packers wanted to move on from LaFleur, they've got a strong link to Harbaugh.

This is what ESPN's Adam Schefter posted on X on Sunday:

"Former Packers President Bob Harlan is royalty in Green Bay. His son Bryan is an agent who represents John Harbaugh. John Harbaugh has deep midwestern roots and ties. If the Packers decide they want to change head coaches, Harbaugh would be the most logical replacement."

MORE:¬†How Josh Allen became eternal hope for the Bills as the playoffs begin

That certainly sounds incredibly compelling.

Harbaugh has been linked to pretty much every opening, including the Dolphins, who didn't fire Mike McDaniel until Harbaugh became available.

He had made the decision reportedly last week not to do any of his interviews until this week ahead. That certainly pointed to a playoff team or two being in the mix for him.

The Packers would make a lot of sense, if they want to take the big swing to dismiss LaFleur and chase down Harbaugh.

title: Continuity may win out for the Eagles at offensive coordinator
description: Eagles fans should temper their expectations for an offseason change at offensive coordinator.
fullText:
Who's ever been told that 'Whatever is understood doesn't need to be explained?' It doesn't take long to understand that it isn't always true in every situation. One could argue that it's understood that Nick Sirianni is currently safe in his role as Philadelphia Eagles head coach. Why are we then hearing discussions about how cool it would be for John Harbaugh to come back home and take over at some point during the offseason?

It seems that those who are back on the 'Fire Nick Sirianni' train need an explanation. Let's resolve any debate quickly here. Nick Sirianni won't be fired. John Harbaugh won't return as this team's head coach. Fortunately, those conversations haven't been entertained or introduced by people who have the power to make that type of move.

It seems unlikely that A.J. Brown will leave. While we're at it, we might as well address that conversation, too. That brings us to Kevin Patullo. Perhaps you've heard. He has also seen his approval rating plunge in some circles. He remains on trial in the court of public opinion.

Hey, we get it! You've been frustrated by the product this Eagles offense has displayed. That has been the case all season. No one is going to tell you that you're wrong for how you feel. This offense has too much talent to be as ineffective as it has been for long stretches of this season.

Some view Saquon Barkley's decline as a concern. Others blame injuries along the offensive line. He's been hit in the backfield much more often this season than he was at any point last year.

Everyone believes Kevin Patullo is part of the problem. As people have done with Nick Sirianni, they've publicly expressed their desire for a change at offensive coordinator.

It seems that there is one major stumbling block to that happening. Coach Sirianni is fiercely loyal to Coach Patullo. The former has been very complimentary of the latter's performance. NFL Network analyst Mike Garafolo recently spoke with Anthony Gargano, and he thinks a win vs. the San Francisco 49ers would be enough to add job security for Philadelphia's offensive coordinator ahead of the offseason.

‚ÄúNick is loyal to Kevin‚Äù 

Mike Garafolo thinks a win vs. the 49ers would be enough for Kevin Patullo to be safe. pic.twitter.com/mknSy48Q6T

‚Äî Anthony Gargano (@AnthonyLGargano) January 9, 2026

With that, we cancel theories of possible Mike McDaniels additions. The Miami Dolphins parted ways with their head coach of the past four NFL seasons, and he immediately became one of the game's most sought-after offensive coordinators.

Though he failed as a head coach, no one questions his acumen as one of the game's top offensive minds. It would be fun to see what he can do with all of the Eagles' talent, but Sirianni's relationship with Patullo dates back to their days with the Indianapolis Colts.

Naturally, we can assume conversations are being entertained behind closed doors that we aren't privy to. No one knows what Howie Roseman and Jeffrey Lurie are offering in terms of their opinions, but if most were willing to gamble, they'd probably say it's certainly possible that Kevin Patullo returns as the Eagles' OC, regardless of what transpires in Philadelphia during their playoff run.

This article originally appeared on Eagles Wire: A reality check for Eagles fans hoping for an OC shake-up

title: Mike Vrabel Gave Patriots‚Äô Will Campbell Special Job During Rookie Season
description: Will Campbell did more than block for Drake Maye during his rookie season. Even as the No. 4 pick, Campbell wasn‚Äôt immune to some playful hazing inside the New England Patriots‚Äô building. Head coach Mike Vrabel tasked the left tackle with an off-field assignment, directing Campbell to address the team with a weekly weather report [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Will Campbell did more than block for Drake Maye during his rookie season.

Even as the No. 4 pick, Campbell wasn‚Äôt immune to some playful hazing inside the New England Patriots‚Äô building. Head coach Mike Vrabel tasked the left tackle with an off-field assignment, directing Campbell to address the team with a weekly weather report during Friday meetings.

As detailed by NBC Sports Boston‚Äôs Phil Perry, Campbell would inform his teammates of community and player events, the lunch menu and other news along with a weather forecast. The 22-year-old eventually took a liking to Vrabel‚Äôs job.

‚ÄúHe volunteered me,‚Äù Campbell said. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt really have a choice, but I‚Äôve enjoyed doing it.‚Äù

Campbell had fun with the role, often turning his address into a comedy routine. Vice president of football operations and strategy John ‚ÄúStretch‚Äù Streicher even wrote jokes for the rookie.

‚ÄúI mean, I was not looking forward to it at first,‚Äù Campbell confessed. ‚ÄúIt wasn‚Äôt something that I got out of bed on Friday morning looking forward to. But now, as long as there‚Äôs some good stuff to read, I don‚Äôt mind it.‚Äù

His teammates also enjoyed Campbell‚Äôs Friday debriefing, but rookie guard Jared Wilson couldn‚Äôt think of any clean material to share with Perry.

‚ÄúYou know, there‚Äôs not a lot that I can,‚Äù Wilson said after a long pause. ‚ÄúBeing totally honest with you. But they‚Äôre good. They‚Äôre good.‚Äù

Campbell‚Äôs gig embodies a looser, jovial culture under Vrabel. Tight end Austin Hooper said the coach has created a ‚Äúwork-hard environment‚Äù while also allowing room for levity.

‚ÄúIf something funny happens, you can laugh,‚Äù Hooper said. ‚ÄúYou can smile. It‚Äôs OK to have whatever your personality is as long as you‚Äôre handling your business and you‚Äôre on top of your details. You can be whoever you want to be as long as you‚Äôre a good teammate and doing your job.‚Äù

Bears Join Patriots With Historic Playoff Comeback Vs. Packers

title: What Bokang Masunyane thinks of ONE Strawweight MMA world champion Joshua Pacio
description: Bokang Masunyane has shared his thoughts on reigning ONE Strawweight MMA world champion Joshua Pacio, praising both the Filipino‚Äôs character and his standing within the division. Known for his speed and relentless pressure, Masunyane has built a reputation as one of the most exciting contenders in ONE Championship.
fullText:
Bokang Masunyane has shared his thoughts on reigning ONE Strawweight MMA world champion Joshua Pacio, praising both the Filipino‚Äôs character and his standing within the division.

Known for his speed and relentless pressure, Masunyane has built a reputation as one of the most exciting contenders in ONE Championship.

But before setting his sights on the title, the South African fighter made clear that his respect for Pacio runs deep ‚Äî even as he plots his route toward the belt.

Masunyane‚Äôs comments highlight the mutual admiration that exists among elite competitors, even when their goals inevitably collide inside the cage.

Speaking to ONE Championship, Masunyane said: ‚ÄúI like Pacio. He‚Äôs got a very good personality, he‚Äôs got a good heart, he‚Äôs a fan‚Äôs favorite in the division.‚Äù

The remark offered a glimpse into the sportsmanship often seen at the highest levels of MMA. While rivals in pursuit of the same prize, Masunyane‚Äôs tone reflected genuine appreciation for Pacio‚Äôs approach both inside and outside competition.

Pacio, who continues to defend his title with composure and skill, has long been viewed as one of the sport‚Äôs most respected champions. His balance of humility and confidence has made him a symbol of consistency for the Strawweight division.

Masunyane‚Äôs praise reinforces how Pacio‚Äôs influence extends beyond his performances ‚Äî shaping how upcoming contenders carry themselves in pursuit of the same success.

Still, Masunyane made it clear that his admiration will not stop his ambition. ‚ÄúAs a fighter, I‚Äôd like to fight as much as I can. Whoever wants to fight me on my way to the title.

‚ÄúThey are standing in my way, and my goal is to get that title shot, so I‚Äôm going through everyone in this division,‚Äù he told ONE Championship.‚Äù

Those words underline the determination driving Masunyane‚Äôs climb. Despite acknowledging Pacio‚Äôs qualities, his focus remains squarely on his own mission, earning the chance to face the champion in the near future.

Masunyane‚Äôs steady rise has positioned him among the top contenders at Strawweight. If his performances continue to impress, the path he‚Äôs describing may soon lead directly to Pacio himself.

For now, respect defines their relationship. But in ONE Championship, respect and rivalry often walk the same line, and Masunyane seems ready to cross it when the opportunity comes.

title: Panthers confirm devastating injury to LT Ikem Ekwonu
description: Panthers HC Dave Canales confirmed a devastating injury for LT Ikem Ekwonu, who was carted off from Saturday's playoff loss.
fullText:
The Carolina Panthers are going into their offseason with two major losses from their first playoff appearance in eight years.

Saturday night's 34-31 defeat to the Los Angeles Rams saw left tackle Ikem Ekwonu make an early exit. Ekwonu was carted off the field in the first quarter with what head coach Dave Canales later described as a "significant" knee injury.

Canales spoke with reporters on Sunday afternoon and confirmed the early belief.

"Ickey has a ruptured patellar tendon, and it's gonna require surgery," he stated. "Timeline-wise, those times vary and all that. But it's significant, it's gonna require surgery.

"So prayers and thoughts for Ickey. Just battled for us and worked through some things along the season. Just a guy that I love, a guy that I really trust out there."

Ekwonu was replaced by Yosh Nijman following his departure.

Canales later added that the rupture is not related to the knee injury that sidelined Ekwonu for the team's Week 16 win over the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

Follow¬†@ThePanthersWire¬†on Twitter/X for more Panthers content.

This article originally appeared on Panthers Wire: Panthers injury updates: LT Ikem Ekwonu ruptures patellar tendon

title: 'Stone Cold' Steve Austin Names His Favorite WWE Rivals
description: WWE Hall of Famer "Stone Cold" Steve Austin named two performers while discussing his greatest pro wrestling rivals.
fullText:
"Stone Cold" Steve Austin had a long list of rivals throughout his 13-year career, with The Rock, Shawn Michaels and Kurt Angle being among some of the best. According to "The Rattlesnake," however, one wrestler stands above the rest as his greatest in-ring adversary.

Speaking on "Insight" with Chris Van Vliet, Austin named Bret Hart as his best rival inside the squared circle, stating that nobody could match the chemistry he had with "The Hitman." According to Austin, their contrasting personas complimented each other.

"Bret Hart's the best there is, the best there was, there ever will be,"¬†Austin said. "Bret, I love working with that guy. We just had instant chemistry. He was a student of the game and a student of other promotions and he had seen what I was doing in WCW, the Stunning Steve Austin, and he knew his style and my style would work well together and it did.¬†Just a trash talking heel that I was, and he was that steady workaholic, working babyface ...¬†I'm very thankful to that guy because he meant a lot to my career."

Despite Hart being his best in-ring nemesis, Austin admitted that the biggest rival of his career was undoubtedly former WWE CEO Vince McMahon.

"Vince, great chemistry," he claimed. "He was the mastermind. I don't know what he's doing now, but that was a feud that transcended the wrestling business. And even if you weren't a wrestling fan, per se, you were interested in being entertained. And so you would put on to see what this motherf****r from South Texas is terrorizing his boss from New York City."

Although McMahon was Austin's greatest rival, when it came to taking his iconic Stunner, the former Chairman was arguably the worst at selling the move according to the six-time WWE Champion.

"Easily Vince is the worst," Austin said. "Vince had so many opportunities and they were always so awful, especially that one at WrestleMania, whichever one it was. It was the one with Kevin Owens. ... It was just terrible, and so, I had to start laughing because I mean, you got to let everybody know that, hey man, this is really bad."

Austin admitted that Vince's wife, Linda McMahon, also ranks high on the all-time worst Stunners list. He feels bad that the move didn't go as planned, but Austin credited her for being a second mom to him during his WWE career.

The WWE star then named which of his opponents were the best at taking the Stunner, explaining that The Rock and Scott Hall are among some of his favorites, but praised Austin Theory and Pat McAfee for the way they sold the move at WrestleMania 38.

"Good kid. I thought man, the sky was the limit for him. He took a great one. McAfee took a great one ... of course when he tumbled out of the ring, he was still drinking the beer while he's laying on the mat. F*****g classic. What an entertainer."

If you use any of the quotes in this article, please credit "Insight" with a h/t to Wrestling Inc. for the transcription.

Don't miss any of the major wrestling headlines. You can also add us as a preferred search source on Google.

title: Ornstein: Paratici to leave Spurs for Fiorentina in February
description: It‚Äôs one last transfer window hurrah for Don Fabio.
fullText:
I think most Tottenham Hotspur fans expected that current Co-Sporting Director Fabio Paratici was leaving the club imminently. The rumors have been flying for weeks now, with Paratici closely linked with a return to Italy to take the Director of Football position at Fiorentina. The only question was when, and now according to David Ornstein we have our answer ‚Äî Paratici will leave Spurs for ‚Äúpersonal reasons‚Äù after the close of the January transfer window.

So this month is the last hurrah for Don Fabio, who will return to Italy after one final scattergun transfer window in order to spend more time with his crimes. It makes a certain amount of sense ‚Äî whatever Tottenham‚Äôs medium-to-long-term plans for the Sporting Director position (and that includes Johan Lange) it would be a little silly to let them both go now when the current window is so incredibly important. It makes you wonder how much his heart is actually in it, but I suppose the job is the job and he‚Äôll do his job until it‚Äôs no longer his job.

Ornstein cites ‚Äúpersonal reasons‚Äù as the reason for Paratici‚Äôs departure despite only getting the Co-Sporting Director position in October, and while I won‚Äôt dwell too much on what those reasons actually are, there were rumors in the Italian media that Paratici‚Äôs partner was homesick and wanted to return to Italy. On that level, I can‚Äôt exactly blame him ‚Äî all things being equal I would also strongly consider leaving London for a life in Florence, though Paratici will have a heck of a job ahead of him turning around a Fiorentina side that looks destined for Serie B next season.

Anyway, at least we know the plan. Hopefully he and Lange can ‚ÄúBentancur‚Äù up a couple more Kulusevskis before he rides off into Northern Italy next month.

title: Derrick White points to specific missed calls in Boston Celtics' loss to San Antonio Spurs
description: "There‚Äôs some calls that are bigger than others that sometimes get missed," said the Colorado native.
fullText:
Star Boston Celtics forward Jaylen Brown is not a fan of the whistle that his team got in Boston's 100-95 loss to Victor Wembanyama and the San Antonio Spurs this past Saturday (Jan. 10) night. But for Celtics point guard Derrick White, it was a handful of high-leverage calls that he feels were missed that were a bigger concern than any potential longer-term issue with the officiating the Celtics may be dealing with.

Asked about the refereeing of the game, and whether Boston was feeling frustrated with their whistle in the loss, the University of Colorado - Boulder alum said "I don‚Äôt know if it bothered us."

"I think we shoot the least amount of free throws in the league, so it‚Äôs not a surprise, I would say," added White.

"But I think there‚Äôs some calls that are bigger than others that sometimes get missed and obviously the one at the end of the half was I was really frustrated about, which cost us two points," he recalled.

"I mean, I don‚Äôt know. I don‚Äôt think it bothered us this back-and-forth game, high level game, and they just made a couple more plays than we did."

title: Paris FC among suitors for Tottenham‚Äôs Mathys Tel
description: Paris FC, who are in the market for attacking reinforcements this month, are one of several clubs interested in taking Tottenham Hotspur forward Mathys Tel (20) on loan, according to¬†RMC Sport¬†journ...
fullText:
Paris FC, who are in the market for attacking reinforcements this month, are one of several clubs interested in taking Tottenham Hotspur forward Mathys Tel (20) on loan, according to¬†RMC Sport¬†journalist¬†Fabrice Hawkins.

Tel has struggled for game time at the start of the season and was initially left out of the club‚Äôs UEFA Champions League squad. Despite making 19 appearances in all competitions, scoring three goals, he has started just five games in the Premier League.

In a bid to make a last-minute push to make the France squad ahead of the FIFA World Cup, Tel is in search of more game time in the second-half of the season and so he is open to leaving Tottenham.

Should he do so, there is plenty of interest. AS Roma and Villarreal are among the interested parties, as are Paris FC, who are looking to stave off relegation.¬†Hawkins¬†understands, however, that Spurs are looking to retain their centre-forward.

title: Aryna Sabalenka posts bold message online moments after Brisbane title win
description: Aryna Sabalenka has started 2026 in strong form, securing the Brisbane International title with a convincing performance. Sabalenka, who also won the event in 2025, took down Marta Kostyuk 6-4, 6-3 in this year‚Äôs final.
fullText:
Aryna Sabalenka has started 2026 in strong form, securing the Brisbane International title with a convincing performance.

Sabalenka, who also won the event in 2025, took down Marta Kostyuk 6-4, 6-3 in this year‚Äôs final.

She did not drop a set throughout the tournament and now holds 22 WTA Tour titles. It was another dominant week for Sabalenka, who continues to build her legacy on tour.

Sabalenka went into Brisbane as the top seed and made her way through a competitive draw that included wins over Madison Keys and Karolina Muchova before finishing with another strong showing against Kostyuk.

Sabalenka has since posted on social media to mark the occasion, sharing on Instagram: ‚ÄúThank you Brisbane International for all the love, it feels so good to be back.

‚ÄúGummy bears and playing doubles with Paula Badosa made this tournament even better. Australia, we are just getting started.‚Äù

In addition to her singles success, Sabalenka also teamed up with Paula Badosa in doubles play. The two, who share a strong friendship off the court, made an appearance together during the tournament.

They won their first match of the event but did not compete in their scheduled quarter-final shortly after.

Sabalenka‚Äôs words are bound to catch the attention of the rest of the WTA Tour, especially given how sharp she looks at this stage of the season.

She clearly enjoys playing in Australia, and her current form only adds to her reputation as a player who thrives in these conditions.

As the top seed, she is set to compete in the Australian Open, a hard-court event where she has secured two of her four Grand Slam titles.

Having also reached the 2025 final, the Belarusian lost to Madison Keys. Meanwhile, Sabalenka has now achieved a remarkable record in Australia, winning 38 of her past 40 matches.

This kind of consistency makes Sabalenka a strong contender for another title run, and few will be surprised if she lifts the trophy again.

title: West Ham analysis: Castellanos scores but Summerville provides spark
description: It was scrappy and uncomfortable at times but far better than the alternative for West Ham, who sit seven points from safety in the Premier League.  Castellanos, playing his second game for the club, will steal the headlines.  The hosts, who made six changes including leaving out Lucas Paqueta while retaining Jarrod Bowen, did not have a shot in the first 32 minutes until Summerville tested QPR goalkeeper Joe Walsh.
fullText:
This was not a free-scoring victory to boost confidence and provide a template for the remainder of the season.

It was scrappy and uncomfortable at times but far better than the alternative for West Ham, who sit seven points from safety in the Premier League.

Castellanos, playing his second game for the club, will steal the headlines. His header was clinical but, in truth, it was Summerville who provided the spark the Hammers required.

The hosts, who made six changes including leaving out Lucas Paqueta while retaining Jarrod Bowen, did not have a shot in the first 32 minutes until Summerville tested QPR goalkeeper Joe Walsh. He then powered beyond Walsh with effectively the last kick of the opening half.

To their credit, West Ham responded well to QPR's equaliser, though the travelling fans were still singing: "Premier League, you're having a laugh."

As the game stretched, Summerville tested Walsh with a curling low strike and then produced a clever turn to put himself in down the left.

It allowed him the space to tee up Castellanos, who was not to be denied.

title: Boston sack manager Coughlan
description: Manager Graham Coughlan leaves Boston United with the Pilgrims in 17th place in the National League.
fullText:
Boston United have "parted company" with manager Graham Coughlan with the Pilgrims in 17th place in the National League.

The club had gone five games without a win and are just three points clear of the relegation zone, with Coughlan's final game coming in the 0-0 draw at Braintree Town on Saturday.

The Irishman took over as manager in November 2024 and led Boston to safety on the penultimate game of the season thanks to a run of 10 wins from 15 games across March and April.

But a run of one win in their last 11 league games since the end of October has now led to his departure.

title: Jaguars-Bills Wild Card discussion: Can Josh Allen outscore Trevor Lawrence?
description: Expect a high-scoring affair, with the team that has the ball last having the chance to advance.
fullText:
The early game on Sunday in the Wild Card round features the Jacksonville Jaguars hosting the Buffalo Bills. The narrative is that this is the year Josh Allen needs to win the Super Bowl because he won‚Äôt have to face the trio of Patrick Mahomes, Joe Burrow, or Lamar Jackson in the postseason. That narrative ignores this Bills team being the least-talented one Allen has had in the playoffs.

The Jags are five percentage points better than the Bills in DVOA. Jacksonville had the 9th-best strength of schedule this season, compared to Buffalo‚Äôs 31st-ranked schedule. The playoffs are generally where you see the difference in the strength of schedule.

We know what Josh Allen will do. He can run all over Jacksonville. The Jags have been great defensively, but they haven‚Äôt really played a tough slate. Will Trevor Lawrence play a clean game? The Bills haven‚Äôt stopped anybody this season‚Äîoutside of the Eagles. The Jags have been rolling on this side of the ball. This feels like a game where Travis Etienne has a big game on the ground.

Expect a high-scoring affair, with the team that has the ball last having the chance to advance.

title: Week 18 picks: Who the experts are taking in Texans vs. Colts
description: Here's who the experts have winning on Sunday afternoon at NRG Stadium between the Indianapolis Colts and Houston Texans for Week 17
fullText:
The Houston Texans are looking to make history on Monday night when they travel to Pittsburgh to take on the Steelers in the wild-card round.

The reason it would be history? Houston's never played a wild-card round game outside of NRG Stadium. And a win would mark the first victory away from home in franchise history.

The¬†Texans‚Äô¬†wild-card round game¬†will air on ESPN at 7 p.m. CT on Monday night. According to BETMGM, the¬†Texans¬†open as a 3.5-point favorite over the Colts, with the over/under set at 41.

Sitting at 12-5 following a 38-30 win over the¬†Indianapolis Colts, the¬†Texans¬†are in great shape for a potential third straight wild-card round win. The Texans are also on the league's longest winning streak, rattling off nine straight to close out the campaign.

As for the Steelers, they're looking to finally win a playoff game for the first time since 2016. Aaron Rodgers hasn't thrown an interception since early November, while the team closed out the regular season winning five of their last six games, including a 28-26 win over the Ravens to clinch a division title on Sunday Night Football.

Who are the experts riding with between the Steelers and Texans? Let's take a look and see which team is expected to win on Monday night at Acrisure Stadium.

Michael Middlehurst-Schwartz: Texans

title: 'Big personality' Martinelli goes from 'idiot' to hat-trick hero
description: Gabriel Martinelli was branded an "idiot" a few days ago - but showed great personality to respond with an FA Cup hat-trick, according to Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta.
fullText:
From being branded an "idiot" to scoring a hat-trick, Gabriel Martinell's name has been in the headlines over the past few days.

The Arsenal winger was heavily criticised for trying to push the injured Conor Bradley off the pitch in the closing stages of Arsenal's 0-0 draw with Liverpool on Thursday, something he apologised for on social media.

But the 24-year-old's first hat-trick for Arsenal - as they came from behind to beat Championship outfit Portsmouth and reach the fourth round of the FA Cup on Sunday - showed "personality", according to his boss.

"It's part of football and then it's how you take it," Mikel Arteta when asked how Martinelli has dealt with being the subject of so much discussion.

"But he knew inside the reason why he did what he did."

Arteta also praised Liverpool boss Arne Slot for his considered response to the incident, when he defended the Brazilian.

"I think Arne Slot spoke brilliantly after the game - speaking of your opponent in the manner that he explained the situation and the fact that Gabi had no intention whatsoever to damage any player," added Arteta.

"That's personality. Come in and talk on the pitch, which is the best part of it."

Martinelli has had a mixed season, losing his starting place in the Premier League to Leandro Trossard after a drop in form and confidence.

He has started just six times for the Gunners, who are six points clear at the top of the table.

However, the winger has been a key player this season for Arsenal in Champions League, scoring five goals in as many appearances. And after his hat-trick against Portsmouth, he is now his side's top scorer.

"That's why to play for a big club, you need a big personality because it can be bad... it can be an action that you miss, it can be something that costs you a game," Arteta added

"And three days later, there is a game. So you need to lift yourself up and make it count.

"I love it. Gabi, in every context that you throw him in, he plays, he doesn't play. He performs well, not well. Today, he scored three goals.

"Tomorrow, he's going to train 100 miles an hour, for sure. He's not going to change that. And that's Gabi."

Martinelli scores hat-trick as Arsenal beat Portsmouth

Arsenal hire ex-Liverpool throw-in coach Gronnemark

Martinelli's hat-trick was the first scored by an Arsenal player in the FA Cup since Theo Walcott did so against Southampton in January 2017.

It was also his first in 249 games for the Gunners and the first time that he has scored more than two goals in a game for a year.

Arteta was not surprised that Martinelli, who is not known for his aerial ability, was able to score twice with his head from corners as "his timing in the box is really good".

Arsenal are well-known for their threat from set-pieces since the appointment of coach Nicolas Jover. They have scored 17 goals from corners in all competitions this season; the most by any Premier League team.

But even by the Gunners' impressive standards, scoring three in a game is a rare occurrence - this was the first time they had done so since May 2022 against Everton.

The game against Portsmouth was the first of four away games in four different competitions for Arsenal - with tests in the Carabao Cup, Premier League and Champions League to come.

They are hoping to end their wait for a trophy - with their last coming when Arteta led them to the 2020 FA Cup, where they beat Portsmouth on the way to lifting the cup.

Arsenal are in a strong position - top of both the Premier League and Champions League tables - while they have won nine of their 10 matches in cup competitions this season, including all five away from home, drawing once.

title: Local official makes bet on Steelers playoff game with Houston-area judge

fullText:

Allegheny County Executive Sara Innamorato and Harris County Judge Lina Hidalgo are in on the wager.

If the Steelers win on Monday, Judge Hidalgo will have to dress in Steelers‚Äô gear and send County Executive Innamorato a NASA jacket. If the Texans win, County Executive Innamorato will don Texans‚Äô merchandise and send Judge Hidalgo a Steel City jacket.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre excited to welcome the Texans to a rowdy Acrisure Stadium on Monday night. As you undoubtedly saw when we defeated the Ravens, the Steel Curtain is ready for anything the Texans throw at us,‚Äù Innamorato said. ‚Äù I‚Äôm confident Judge Hidalgo will enjoy wearing some black and gold in the near future.‚Äù

Judge Hidalgo feels just as confident about her team.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs great that the Pittsburgh Steelers think they have a shot against our Texans in the Wild Card Round! I look forward to seeing County Executive Innamorato in blue and red at a public address,‚Äù she said.
